lib_TEA

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • lib_TEA.Path

  • public class Path
extends java.lang.Object

    Path

    The Path class includes all the methods to manage paths within the TEA language. TEA Development Team
    Author:
    Enddy Y. Gonzales Figueroa, Jonathan A. Roman Morell, Enrique J. Vargas Figueroa

      Creates Path object.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • isAbsolute

        public boolean isAbsolute()
        Returns TRUE if Path is an absolute path, FALSE otherwise.
        Returns:
        TRUE if Path is an absolute path, FALSE otherwise

      • exists

        public boolean exists()
        Returns TRUE if Path is an absolute path that exist on disk, FALSE otherwise.

        Note: If Path is an empty path, this method returns TRUE because:

        • (Windows) the empty path refers to the list of drives mapped to the computer.
        • (Mac OS X) the empty path refers to the mounted volumes.
        • (Linux) the empty path refers to the root directory.
        Returns:
        TRUE if Path is an absolute path that exist on disk, FALSE otherwise

      • get

        public java.lang.String get(int index)
        Returns the element (directory or file) of the Path at index. For example, if: Path path1 = dirA/dirB/dirC/file.name Calling path1.get(2) returns dirB index can be negative. In such case get function start counting from the right.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the element in Path to get. If index is out of range (>=|N|, where N is the number of elements in Path), the function returns null. index can be negative; in this case the function starts counting from the right.
        Returns:
        Element in Path at index. null if not found.

      • getFileName

        public java.lang.String getFileName()
        Returns the name of a File. Path must be absolute, the last element must be a file name and the file must exist, otherwise returns null.
        Returns:
        Name of File including extension or null if file does not exist.

      • create

        public boolean create(boolean isFile)
        Creates the appropriate directory specified by Path. Path must be absolute.

        This function creates all the directories that do not already exist in the specified path. If the directory already exist at the specified location, the function returns Path without overwriting the existing directory.

        Returns:
        TRUE if directory is created or already exist. FALSE otherwise

      • concat

        public Path concat(Path relativePath)
        Creates a new path by appending a name or a relative path to an existing (base) path.
        Parameters:
        relativePath - name or relative path is the new path component to be appended to the base path. If relativePath is empty this function returns the base path. If relativePath is absolute this function returns null.
        Returns:
        Resulting path.

      • remove

        public boolean remove()
        Deletes the directory or file in Path. Path must be absolute.
        Returns:
        TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

      • select

        public Path select(int index)
        Returns a subset of Path with index elements, starting from an end point. If index >= 0, returns the first index elements. If index < 0, it returns the last index elements.
        Parameters:
        index -
        Returns:
        Subset of Path
        See Also:
        select(int start, int end)

      • select

        public Path select(int start,
                   int end)
        Returns a subset of Path. start and end are the indexes of the beginning and finish of the subset, respectively. start must be less than end (start < end) otherwise the function returns null.
        Parameters:
        start - beginning of subset of Path
        end - finish of subset of Path
        Returns:
        subset of Path; null if subset cannot be obtained.
        See Also:
        select(int index)

      • isDirectory

        public boolean isDirectory()
        Return TRUE if Path is an existing directory. Path must be absolute.
        Returns:
        TRUE if Path is an existing directory, FALSE otherwise.

      • getExtension

        public java.lang.String getExtension()
        Returns the extension of the last element in Path, if it exist.
        Returns:
        extension of the last element in Path, if it exist; null otherwise
